info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 4:49AM EDT until April 8 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River at Muncie down to Ravenswood.
.Widespread minor flooding is occurring or will begin this morning on the White River from Muncie down through Ravenswood due to prior rains and additional light rainfall through Sunday. The crest on the upper Wabash will occur from this evening to Monday and at points downstream thereafter.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River at Noblesville.
* WHEN...Until Tuesday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, The Home for Friendless Animals kennel on River Avenue in southern Noblesville Township may have to evacuate animals.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 17.7 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this evening by around 800 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY EVENING
